<!-- OFFICER: Kallie -->
:::{.callout-note collapse="false"}
## Kallie Hill (she/her)

:::{style="padding-left:10px"}
### **Kallie Hill (she/her)**

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width="30%"}
<img src = "../Images/Profiles/Hill_Kallie.png" width = 70%>
:::

:::{.column width="70%"}

Kallie was born and raised in Santa Barbara and considers herself a California girl at heart. She studied Mathematics at UCSB as an undergrad, and began working for UCSB as an undergrad. After graduation she began working for the ECE dept here at UCSB, transferring after four years to the PBS Dept for an additional 4 years. She has now worked in the PSTAT Dept for two years, and considers Diversity, Equity and Inclusion to be the keystone in any working environment. In her spare time you can find her hanging out with her husband, Chris, and golden retriever, Atticus (Yes! Exactly like Atticus Finch! One of her fictional icons.)

- **Departmental Role:** Business Officer
- **Email:** <a href="mailto:mso@pstat.ucsb.edu">mso@pstat.ucsb.edu</a>
:::

<!-- OFFICER: Dr. Miller -->

## Dr. Jack Miller (they/them)

:::{style="padding-left:10px"}
### **Dr. Jack Miller (they/them)**

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width="30%"}
<img src = "../Images/Profiles/Miller_JB.jpg" width = 70%>
:::

:::{.column width="70%"}

Professor Miller joined PSTAT as a Teaching Professor in November 2022. They are interested in teaching statistics and data science to undergraduates, mentoring undergraduate students, and working with and mentoring teaching associates with all things teaching from creating a supportive learning environment where all students are included and feel a sense of belonging to handling challenges as they arise. Additionally, Professor Miller is the faculty advisor for oSTEM@UCSB. Outside of professional activities, they enjoy long walks their golden retriever Luna, bird watching, and hanging out with their fabulous spouse.

- **Departmental Role:** Teaching Professor
- **Email:** <a href="mailto:jbmiller@pstat.ucsb.edu">jbmiller@pstat.ucsb.edu</a>

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width="30%"}
<img src = "../Images/Profiles/Marzban_E.png" width = 70%>
:::

:::{.column width="70%"}

A Seattle native, Ethan moved to Santa Barbara from the Bay Area to join the PhD program back in Fall 2020. Since then, he has been passionate making the department a more welcoming and communal space (in addition to his research, as well as a passion for statistics education). Outside of school, he enjoys discovering new coffee shops, making use of the beautiful Santa Barbara weather, and talking everyone's ears off about cats. Ethan is also currently serving as the Lead Teaching Assistant (TA) for the department and is as such happy to field any questions about or concerns over Teaching Assistantships!
